response: The Northern Ireland Masters is a professional golf tournament played at Clandeboye Golf Club in Newtownards, Northern Ireland. It was originally played as a one-off event on the Challenge Tour in September 2003. Darren Clarke won the inaugural event by two shots ahead of Stuart Little.
